metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8283 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description: dpkg-source in dpkg 1.3.0 through 1.18.23 is able to use a non-GNU patch program and does not offer a protection mechanism for blank-indented diff hunks, which allows remote attackers to conduct directory traversal attacks via a crafted Debian source package, as demonstrated by use of dpkg-source on NetBSD.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This only affects operating systems that don't use GNU patch by default, which isn't the case on Debian/Ubuntu. Setting priority to negligible.

criterions.comment: dpkg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
